      GreenLeaders Gold level
      Kimpton Sir Francis Drake Hotel, housed in a landmark building in the heart of Union Square, is quintessential San Francisco: exciting, romantic, timelessly elegant and unique. The ornately decorated lobby, old-world hospitality, and Tom Sweeney, the hotel's infamous Beefeater doorman, transport you to another time and place. The legendary Starlight Room, the adjacent Scala's Bistro and unmatched hospitality complete the picture to create an unforgettable San Francisco experience.

      Good location but pretty average
      Rooms a bit tired and could be a bit cleaner. Not much else to do in the hotel, so just view this as a base. Images on website make the hotel seem much bigger than it is. Everything (and I mean everything, including water bottles) must be paid for as extras and a pretty pricey.

      KiryC wrote a review Jul 23
      Washington DC90 contributions34 helpful votes
      Below Average Service
      Nice hotel, but the service was lacking in several areas. Upon checkin, the first room assigned was not ready and the cleaning and maintenance crew were in there when I entered. Back to the front desk. Second room also not ready, cleaning crew still in there. Back to the front desk. THIRD room was fine -- until I was lying on the bed and the cleaning crew burst in. Apparently no communication between the front desk and cleaning crew. Final insult, I left an eyemask in the side table drawer and called to leave a message about it and also sent an email -- have yet to hear back from anyone. Poor service for this level of hotel.…

      A beautiful hotel
      We visited the hotel with a family of 4 and we had a room with 2 queen sized beds and it was a comfortable size for us. The room was beautifully decorated and perfectly clean. All the staff were extremely friendly and always willing to help. The lobby was extraordinary and between 5 and 6 there was a complimentary wine reception with free drinks and snacks for all. I would highly recommend.…

      The boys wrote a review Jul 21
      Gold Coast, Australia9 contributions
      Not what you would expect
      This hotel got me by surprise for the money and the parking price you just don't get your moneys worth the hotel itself looks beautiful but when you look closely it's worn and tied in places chipped floor tiles ripped wall paper and bits of paint missing on edging. Also the parking is overpriced and not done by the hotel themselves it's a different company. The rooms had a damp or wet smell as well as noisy they also had not tea,coffee or fridge and for the price you would think these things would come with the rooms. When it comes down to it you can get alot more from other hotels in the area for your money and the parking well everywhere else was cheeper to park your car some by half the amount. I think the hotel is relying on its location to justify there price I won't be using this hotel again when returning…

      Response from _sirfrancisdrake_sf, General Manager at Kimpton Sir Francis Drake Hotel
      Responded 1 week ago
      Thank you for sharing your review, 55673398959. We appreciate the feedback and have shared this with our facilities' teams to look into the conditions you mentioned, both in the public spaces and the guest room. We're sorry that we weren't able to welcome you to our morning coffee and tea service in Scala's Bistro. We can always set-up a coffee maker (and mini-fridge!) per request but we host a great complimentary coffee station complimentary for all hotel guests in our ground-floor restaurant every morning. Thanks again for giving us a shot and for taking the time to share your experience. -David
